column4: Off-topic question for the channel.  What is the state of ubuntu and EXT4?  Anyone using it?  are the performance gains worth it?  I am asking because I know there was some problems with ext4 before.  btw I am on jaunty.
xfs will get you everything ext4 does
is xfs available in ubuntu installer?
yes
sorry new question.  xfs or zfs?
i dont think zfs is a common option
yeah i doesnt seem to be.  but looking at wikipedia says xfs is 64 bit.  and zfs is 128.  seems a few OS's are trying to implement.  even OSX...
xfs has been a standard part of linux for 6+ years now and does pretty much everything ext4 brags about.. you still have to go out of your way to use zfs
do you find xfs any more difficult to setup than ext3 ??  will I have to format my ext3 for xfs?  I find this to be a nice feature of ext4(no need to format)...
no, you dont do anyhting different than just picking it from the menu
ty
err. if you already HAVE ext3 system, yeah you'd have to format
i thought you meant on an install
do you think the original ext4 kernel stability problems in ubuntu have been fixed?
i dont know, i dont like the way its so many years behind though, i prefer something more proven
yet that still has the featurse i want
agreed.
xfs was made by SGI, who make high performance graphic systems for CGI effects in movies
yeah i read that on wikipedia.
are you switching or talking about a new install/?
i am thinking about just switching.  there is pages that describe doing the conversion.  without formatting.
oh thast not worth it really
why not?  would it not achieve the same in the end?
